tournament.name: MKM Commander Tournament (Hradec Kralove, Czech republic)

decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent quickly. The combination of efficient mana dorks and powerful threats like Doran, the Siege Tower, Knight of the Reliquary, and Anafenza, the Foremost allows the deck to apply pressure early on. In addition, the deck includes various removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares, Abrupt Decay, and Toxic Deluge to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach helps disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish an aggressive tempo while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck revolves around controlling the board through counterspells, removal, and lockdown effects while using Grand Arbiter Augustin IV to make spells cheaper for the player and more expensive for the opponent. The deck includes a wide variety of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to maintain control over the game. In addition, there are also card draw effects and tutors to help find key pieces of the combo. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient resource management and precise decision-making.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander to lead an aggressive strategy, focusing on quickly putting pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a variety of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mana base that allows for consistency and flexibility, the deck aims to deploy threats early and often, while also packing removal and disruption to maintain an advantage. By combining aggressive creatures with powerful disruption and removal spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the pace of the game, ultimately securing victory through a combination of combat damage and attrition.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize the commander, Rafiq of the Many, to create a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures, protective spells, and equipment to maximize the commander's capabilities and overwhelm opponents. The goal is to quickly establish board presence, control the game with countermagic and removal spells, and finish off opponents with Rafiq's ability to double the damage output of creatures. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage, mana acceleration, and flexibility to adapt to various situations. Overall, the strategy focuses on being proactive, applying pressure early in the game, and maintaining a strong position to secure victory.

This control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to stall the opponent's game plan while utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as a win condition. The deck includes a wide range of control spells like Force of Will, Counterspell, Swords to Plowshares, and Supreme Verdict to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dig Through Time to maintain resources. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and protecting Geist of Saint Traft to deal consistent damage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control game plan with utility lands and mana-fixing lands to ensure smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on utilizing Kaalia of the Vast's ability to cheat powerful creatures into play quickly to set up game-winning combos. It includes a mix of mana acceleration, disruption, and powerful creatures to create a strong board presence. The deck aims to control the game with targeted removal and disruption spells while rapidly deploying threatening creatures like Balefire Dragon, Iona, Shield of Emeria, and Griselbrand. By combining fast mana acceleration with powerful creatures that can swing the game in your favor, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and win through powerful combos and aggressive attacking. The key strategy is to efficiently deploy Kaalia's ability to quickly assemble a powerful board state and disrupt opponents' plans while closing out the game with game-ending creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to build a strong aggro strategy around Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander. The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Birds of Paradise and Arbor Elf, using powerful land cards like Gaea's Cradle and Cavern of Souls to support the strategy. The deck includes a mix of creatures like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Purphoros, God of the Forge for aggressive plays, along with utility cards like Swords to Plowshares and Nature's Claim for removal and disruption. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells, leveraging the strengths of Marath and the supporting cards to ensure victory in fast-paced one-on-one matches.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana dorks and land-fetching spells in order to bring out powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. The deck also includes cards like Titania, Protector of Argoth and Terastodon to generate value from sacrificing lands. With cards like Birthing Pod and Yisan, the Wanderer Bard, the deck has a toolbox approach, allowing the player to fetch specific threats as needed. In addition, the deck includes removal spells like Beast Within and Acidic Slime to deal with opposing threats, as well as equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte to increase the power of creatures on the battlefield. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient mana usage.
